dependencies.description:
CD-HIT is a very widely used program for clustering and comparing
protein or nucleotide sequences.
dependencies.name: cdhit

dependencies.description: Clustal Omega: the last alignment program you'll ever need.
dependencies.name: clustal-omega

dependencies.description:
MAFFT is a multiple sequence alignment program for unix-like operating
systems. It offers a range of multiple alignment methods, L-INS-i
(accurate; for alignment of <~200 sequences), FFT-NS-2 (fast; for
alignment of <~30,000 sequences), etc.
dependencies.name: mafft

dependencies.description: Fast genome and metagenome distance estimation using MinHash.
dependencies.name: mash

dependencies.description: A powerful multiple sequence alignment browser.
dependencies.name: prank

dependencies.description:
Prokka is a software tool to annotate bacterial, archaeal and viral
genomes quickly and produce standards-compliant output files.
dependencies.name: prokka

dependencies.description:
A distributed collaborative effort to develop Python libraries and
applications which address the needs of current and future work in
bioinformatics.
dependencies.name: py-biopython

dependencies.description:
DendroPy is a Python library for phylogenetic computing. It provides
classes and functions for the simulation, processing, and manipulation
of phylogenetic trees and character matrices, and supports the reading
and writing of phylogenetic data in a range of formats, such as NEXUS,
NEWICK, NeXML, Phylip, FASTA, etc.
dependencies.name: py-dendropy

dependencies.description:
Lightweight, super fast library for sequence alignment using edit
(Levenshtein) distance.
dependencies.name: py-edlib

dependencies.description:
GFF and GTF file manipulation and interconversion gffutils is a Python
package for working with and manipulating the GFF and GTF format files
typically used for genomic annotations. Files are loaded into a sqlite3
database, allowing much more complex manipulation of hierarchical
features (e.g., genes, transcripts, and exons) than is possible with
plain-text methods alone.
dependencies.name: py-gffutils

dependencies.description:
The intbitset library provides a set implementation to store sorted
unsigned integers either 32-bits integers or an infinite range with fast
set operations implemented via bit vectors in a Python C extension for
speed and reduced memory usage.
dependencies.name: py-intbitset

dependencies.description: Lightweight pipelining with Python functions.
dependencies.name: py-joblib

dependencies.description:
Matplotlib is a comprehensive library for creating static, animated, and
interactive visualizations in Python.
dependencies.name: py-matplotlib

dependencies.description:
NetworkX is a Python package for the creation, manipulation, and study
of the structure, dynamics, and functions of complex networks.
dependencies.name: py-networkx

dependencies.description: Fundamental package for array computing in Python.
dependencies.name: py-numpy

dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-pip

dependencies.description: An interactive, browser-based graphing library for Python
dependencies.name: py-plotly

dependencies.description: A set of python modules for machine learning and data mining.
dependencies.name: py-scikit-learn

dependencies.description: Fundamental algorithms for scientific computing in Python.
dependencies.name: py-scipy

dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-setuptools

dependencies.description: A Fast, Extensible Progress Meter
dependencies.name: py-tqdm

dependencies.description: A built-package format for Python.
dependencies.name: py-wheel

dependencies.description: The Python programming language.
dependencies.name: python

dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment
dependencies.name: python-venv

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
